data.title: On This Day - May 19 1962: Derry GAA All-Ireland hero Damian Barton is born
data.meta_description: Sporting greats, dates and a quick quiz blitz toÂ get you up and running today...
data.text:
ON THIS DAY

1965: Bobby Moore captained West Ham to victory in the European Cup Winners' Cup final against 1860 Munich at Wembley.

1976: Liverpool enjoyed European glory as they drew 1-1 with Club Brugge to seal a 4-3 aggregate victory in the UEFA Cup final.

1984: Everton won the FA Cup for the fourth time, beating Watford 2-0 at Wembley.

2006: Thierry Henry ended speculation linking him with Barcelona - for a year, at least - by signing a new four-year contract at Arsenal.

2007: Chelsea beat Manchester United 1-0 in the FA Cup final with a Didier Drogba goal in extra time to complete a cup double.

2011: The Football Association's board agreed to abstain in the vote for the FIFA presidency.

2012: Chelsea won the Champions League for the first time in their history, beating Bayern Munich 4-3 on penalties after a 1-1 draw in the final on the German club's home ground.

2015: Dave King's application to sit on the Rangers board was approved after the Scottish Football Association board ruled him a "fit and proper" person.

BIRTHDAYS

Bert van Marwijk (soccer) - former Holland coach who led the team to the 2010 World Cup final, currently manager of Saudi Arabia, born 1952.

Tony Coton (soccer) - former Manchester City and Watford goalkeeper, born 1961.

Damien Barton (gaelic games): current manager of the Derry senior football squad, a former All-Ireland Championship winner with his county in 1993, Derry, under manager Eamonn Coleman, defeated Cork 1-14 to 2-8 in front of a crowd of over 64,000 at Croke Park in Dublin, born 1962.

Dario Franchitti (motor racing) - four-time IndyCar Series champion and three-time Indy 500 winner from Scotland, born 1973.

Andrew Johns (rugby league) - former Warrington Wolves and Australia half-back, born 1974.

Manuel Almunia (soccer) - former Arsenal and Watford goalkeeper, born 1977.

Diego Forlan (soccer) - former Uruguay international and Manchester United, Atletico Madrid and Inter Milan striker, now with Penarol, born 1979.

Andrea Pirlo (soccer) - Former Juventus and Italy World Cup-winning midfielder now with New York City, born 1979.

SPORT ON TV

Today

GAELIC GAMES, etc: Men in Black: Following four referees in different sports - Gaelic football, rugby union, hurling and football - Setanta Ireland 1930

CRICKET: Test Series, England v Sri Lanka - Sky Sports 1, 1000; IPL, Gujarat Lions v Kolkata Knight Riders - Sky Sports 1, 1500.

SOCCER: League One play-off semi-final second leg, Walsall v Barnsley - Sky Sports 1, 1930; Scottish Premiership play-off, Falkirk v Kilmarnock - BT Sport 1, 1900; WSL, Birmingham v Reading - BT Sport 2, 1915.

CYCLING: Giro d'Italia - Eurosport 1, 1330; Tour of California - Eurosport 1, 2200.

TENNIS: French Open Qualifying - Eurosport 2, 0900; ATP, Geneva Open - Eurosport 2, 1200.

GOLF: Irish Open: Joanne Cantwell is joined by John McHenry to present live coverage of day one of the event, held this year at the K Club in Straffan, Co Kildare. With reports from Dave Kelly.- RTE 2 1230; European Tour, Irish Open - Sky Sports 4, 1230; PGA, AT&T Byron Nelson - Sky Sports 4, 2100.

DARTS: Premier League - Sky Sports 2, 1900.

MOTORSPORT: WRC Portugal - BT Sport/ESPN, 1900.

BASEBALL: MLB, New York Mets v Washington Nationals - BT Sport 2, 0000 (Fri).

BASKETBALL: NBA Playoffs, Cleveland Cavaliers v Toronto Raptors - BT Sport 1, 0130 (Fri).

SWIMMING: European Championships - BBC Two England, 1830 & Eurosport 1, 1000.

Tomorrow

CRICKET: Test Series, England v Sri Lanka - Sky Sports 1, 1030; IPL, Delhi Daredevils v Sunrisers Hyderabad - Sky Sports 1, 1500; T20 Blast, Essex Eagles v Surrey - Sky Sports 2, 1900.

RUGBY UNION: Super Rugby, Crusaders v Waratahs - Sky Sports 1, 0830; PRO12 Playoffs: Leinster v Ulster (Kick-off 7.45pm). Coverage of the opening PRO12 play-off semi-final from Royal Dublin Society. Presented by Maire Treasa Ni Dhubhghaill, with commentary by Garry Mac Donnacha - TG4 1915; Leinster v Ulster - Sky Sports 3, 1930; Stephen Watson presents coverage of the opening PRO12 semi-final, which comes from the RDS Arena. With commentary by Jim Neilly and Ryan Constable, and reports from Stephen Ferris and Andy Ward- BBC 2 1930.

SOCCER: League One play-off semi-final second leg, Millwall v Bradford City - Sky Sports 1, 1930; MLS, fixture TBC - BT Sport 1, 0130 (Sat).

ATHLETICS: Great Manchester City Games - BBC Two England, 1800.

CYCLING: Giro d'Italia - Eurosport 1, 1245; Tour of California - Eurosport 1, 2200.

TENNIS: French Open Qualifying - Eurosport 2, 1300; ATP, Geneva Open - Eurosport 2, 1100.

MOTORCYCLING: MotoGP Italy - BT Sport 2, 0800.

MOTORSPORT: WRC Portugal - BT Sport/ESPN, 1900.

GOLF: Irish Open: Joanne Cantwell is joined by John McHenry to present live coverage of day one of the event, held this year at the K Club in Straffan, Co Kildare. With reports from Dave Kelly.- RTE 2 930 and 1530;;European Tour, Irish Open - Sky Sports 4, 0930; PGA, AT&T Byron Nelson - Sky Sports 4, 2100.

SWIMMING: European Championships - Eurosport 1, 1100.

BASEBALL: MLB, Houston Astros v Texas Rangers - BT Sport/ESPN, 0100 (Sat).

QUICK QUIZ BLITZ

1 In which year did Hull win promotion to the Premier League via the play-offs, with Dean Windass' volleyed winner against Bristol City?

2 Who is the manager of the Down senior hurling team?

3 Team Sky rider Peter Kennaugh won an Olympic gold medal in which track cycling event at London 2012?

4 Who scored Chelsea's winning penalty, and their equaliser in normal time, when they won the 2012 Champions League final against Bayern Munich?

5 The NFL franchise the Panthers play in which city?

QUICK QUIZ BLITZ answers: 1 2008; 2 Michael Johnston 3 Team pursuit; 4 Didier Drogba; 5 Charlotte, North Carolina (Carolina Panthers).

ends
